alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 8:20PM EDT until July 10 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Charleston. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 810 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that 4 to 5 inches of rain has fallen across the Church Creek basin near West Ashley today. A 755 PM, the water level on Church Creek was observed at 5.43 feet and slowly rising. Church Creek is expected to crest just above the flood stage of 5.5 feet this evening. At 5.5 feet, portions of Winners Circle will become flooded with water. Also, water will begin to approach the Crosstowne Church. - Periods of moderate downpours will be possible later this evening. This additional rain will slow to rate of water level falls. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, West Ashley, Johns Island, Hollywood, Magnolia Gardens, Shadowmoss and Red Top.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
